channel.title: [Updated] Zaros GS + Guthix GS + Dragon Shortsword + Energy Sword

item.title: [Updated] Zaros GS + Guthix GS + Dragon Shortsword + Energy Sword
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Never get the drop model and the wear model mixed guys… I just did, and well… The inventory icon was a Man (NPC 0) and when wearing it was an alter of some sort (I had never seen the alter before…)

Anyways, here’s my Energy Sword ints [Renamed]

    case 19830:
		itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
		itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wield";
		itemDef.modelid = 67879;// Drop Model
		itemDef.modelZoom = 1570;
		itemDef.modelRotationY = 400;
		itemDef.modelRotationX = 360;
		itemDef.anInt204 = 0;
		itemDef.modelOffset1 = 0;
		itemDef.modelOffset2 = -5;
		itemDef.anInt165 = 67878;// Female Wield Model
		itemDef.anInt200 = 67878;//Male Wield Model
		itemDef.anInt188 = -1;
		itemDef.anInt164 = -1;
		itemDef.anInt175 = -1;
		itemDef.anInt197 = -1;
		// itemDef.aBoolean176 = false;
		itemDef.name = "Energy sword";
		itemDef.description = "A strong sword made of energy.";
	break;

I’ll get to the rest here in a min <3

EDIT: Elve, the dragon short sword link is dead…

EDIT2:
Good news. Got the Guthix GS working 

	case 19834:
		 itemDef.itemActions = new String[5];
		 itemDef.itemActions[1] = "Wield";
		 itemDef.modelid = 67883; //drop model id
		 itemDef.modelZoom = 1957;
		 itemDef.modelRotationX = 498;
		 itemDef.modelRotationY = 484;
		 itemDef.anInt204 = 0;
		 itemDef.modelOffset1 = -1;
		 itemDef.modelOffset2 = -1;
		 itemDef.anInt165 = 67882;// wield model id
		 itemDef.anInt200 = 67882;
		 itemDef.anInt188 = -1;
		 itemDef.anInt164 = -1;
		 itemDef.anInt175 = -1;
		 itemDef.anInt197 = -1;
		 // itemDef.aBoolean176 = false;
		 itemDef.name = "Guthix godsword";
		 itemDef.description = "A beautiful, heavy sword.";
	break;

Bad News:
The Zaros GS is trolling the hell out of me.

Read full topic

item.title: [Updated] Zaros GS + Guthix GS + Dragon Shortsword + Energy Sword
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

I have seen a lot of servers who use these models/items, and the colors are wrong, the model is twice the size of the character, the drop model looks dumb, or sometimes aren’t animated right.

The godsword I know is a recolor/remake of Jagex’s original item, but I found the one everyone has is a cheap knock-off (as the zaros symbol is horrible).


http://uppit.com/263egx7w369h/Zaros_Godsword.rar

if (i == 10000) { //your ID of the item here class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield"; class8.anInt174 = 12058; //drop model id class8.anInt181 = 1957; class8.anInt190 = 498; class8.anInt198 = 484; class8.anInt204 = 0; class8.anInt169 = -1; class8.anInt194 = -1; class8.anInt165 = 12057;// wield model id class8.anInt200 = 12057; class8.anInt188 = -1; class8.anInt164 = -1; class8.anInt175 = -1; class8.anInt197 = -1; // class8.aBoolean176 = false; class8.aString170 = "Zaros godsword"; class8.aByteArray178 = "A beautiful, heavy sword.".getBytes(); }

The Guthix GS has correct colors even if they look off; I pulled them straight from another article of guthix armor. Shouldn’t have any problems with this model, the drop and wield model are positioned the exact same as the other godswords.

if (i == 10001) { //your ID of the item here class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield"; class8.anInt174 = #####; //drop model id class8.anInt181 = 1957; class8.anInt190 = 498; class8.anInt198 = 484; class8.anInt204 = 0; class8.anInt169 = -1; class8.anInt194 = -1; class8.anInt165 = #####;// wield model id class8.anInt200 = #####; class8.anInt188 = -1; class8.anInt164 = -1; class8.anInt175 = -1; class8.anInt197 = -1; // class8.aBoolean176 = false; class8.aString170 = "Guthix godsword"; class8.aByteArray178 = "A beautiful, heavy sword.".getBytes(); }

http://www.mediafire.com/?6pk01cm74x1lfaf - (Guthix GS DL)

The dragon short sword - is a different story; I found it in with some of my really old files I’m pretty sure I made it (since it has a drop model).

http://uppit.com/69fr5d4tqz9s/Dragon_shortsword.rar

if (i == 10002) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield"; class8.anInt174 = 14200; class8.anInt181 = 1570; class8.anInt190 = 400; class8.anInt198 = 360; class8.anInt204 = 0; class8.anInt169 = 0; class8.anInt194 = -5; class8.anInt165 = 14201;// wield class8.anInt200 = 14201; class8.anInt188 = -1; class8.anInt164 = -1; class8.anInt175 = -1; class8.anInt197 = -1; // class8.aBoolean176 = false; class8.aString170 = "Dragon shortsword"; class8.aByteArray178 = "Pointy.".getBytes(); }

MediaFire

Energy sword in .gz form.rar

MediaFire is a simple to use free service that lets you put all your photos, documents, music, and video in a single place so you can access them anywhere and share them everywhere.

This is a cool sword, honestly everyone has played halo at some point; this version a bit different than the one on the game, you notice that one blade is bigger than the other one. The wireframe was redone, and a new handle was made. Special thanks to amy_webb for helping.

if (i == 10003) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Wield"; class8.anInt174 = 14200; class8.anInt181 = 1570; class8.anInt190 = 400; class8.anInt198 = 360; class8.anInt204 = 0; class8.anInt169 = 0; class8.anInt194 = -5; class8.anInt165 = 14201;// wield class8.anInt200 = 14201; class8.anInt188 = -1; class8.anInt164 = -1; class8.anInt175 = -1; class8.anInt197 = -1; // class8.aBoolean176 = false; class8.aString170 = "Energy sword"; class8.aByteArray178 = "A strong sword made of energy.".getBytes(); }

I would suggest just packing these in the cache and making new ints via cache also instead of hard coding them in. I will be doing more of these, thank you.

Enjoy.

Read full topic
